etymologies: mid 19th century: from French saponine, from Latin sapo, sapon- ‘soap’

definitions: a toxic compound which is present in soapwort and makes foam when shaken with water.
shortDefinitions: toxic compound which is present in soapwort

definitions: any of the class of steroid and terpenoid glycosides typified by this, examples of which are used in detergents and foam fire extinguishers.
shortDefinitions: any of class of steroid and terpenoid glycosides which foam when shaken with water, examples of which are used in detergents
